title: Surgery and other medical procedures are delayed by the Kaiser strike, patients say
description: Surgeries were rescheduled and other procedures were postponed as tens of thousands of Kaiser Permanente healthcare workers began to strike Wednesday.

title: Nasal esketamine works better than alternative for treatment-resistant depression, study finds
description: Spravato, a nasal spray esketamine, was found to work better than Seroquel for treatment-resistant depression, a study in the New England Journal of Medicine finds.

title: Police arrest 16-year-old after Asian American woman is attacked on Boston train
description: Transit police in Boston arrested a 16-year-old male on Monday after a group of teens was recorded harassing an Asian American woman with racist language and trying to block her from leaving a train.

title: Ron DeSantis' money problems deepen ahead of a key stretch in the GOP primary
description: Ron DeSantis' campaign entered this month with just $5 million in primary cash, reigniting doubts about his solvency and ability to gain on Donald Trump.

title: Tupac Shakur murder suspect made deal with feds 14 years ago that could hurt the case
description: Could a deal struck 14 years ago between California officials and the suspect in the murder of Tupac Shakur jeopardize the Nevada prosecution in the death of the hip hop icon?

title: ‘Saturday Night Live’ to welcome back Pete Davidson as host for season premiere
description: "Saturday Night Live" is returning for Season 49 on Oct. 14.

title: 'Good' cholesterol levels may increase dementia risk
description: While the benefits of ‘good’ HDL cholesterol have been touted by some, a new study finds that both high and low levels of HDL cholesterol can increase dementia risk.

title: Simone Biles leads U.S. women's gymnastics team to world gold after teammate's injury
description: Simone Biles led the U.S. women’s gymnastics team to another team gold medal at the 2023 Artistic Gymnastics World Championships in Antwerp, Belgium, on Wednesday.

title: Woman learns her ancestors were enslaved by a congressman’s ancestors
description: Lacretia Johnson Flash was intrigued when she learned who enslaved her ancestors: the family of Kentucky congressman Brett Guthrie.

title: Two 1-year-old girls drown in swimming pool at day care facility in California
description: Two 1-year-old girls drowned in a backyard swimming pool at a day care facility in San Jose, California, on Monday.

title: Travis Kelce says NFL is 'overdoing it a little bit' with Taylor Swift coverage
description: Taylor Swift fans were buzzing this past weekend when the 12-time Grammy Award winner attended the Kansas City Chiefs’ matchup against the New York Jets at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey.

title: Biden says he will deliver 'major' speech on Ukraine
description: President Joe Biden said on Wednesday that he would deliver a "major" speech about funding for Ukraine.

title: Many LGBTQ people report having experienced conversion therapy, study finds
description: A new study found that trans people reported experiencing discredited and harmful conversion therapy at a higher rate than gays and lesbians.

title: The five injured in Morgan State University shooting were not the intended targets, police say
description: Baltimore police were searching for suspects Wednesday morning after five bystanders were wounded following gunfire during homecoming week celebrations on the campus of Morgan State University.

title: Steve Scalise seeking to lock up support for speaker job after Kevin McCarthy ouster
description: Who is going to be the next House speaker? Steve Scalise is trying to lock up the job.

title: Striking Kaiser Permanente workers say patients and employees are suffering under staffing shortages
description: Out in force from California to Virginia, workers called for the health care employer to address staffing shortages that they say are at crisis levels.

title: Man accused of kidnapping Charlotte Sena previously charged in domestic choking incident
description: Craig N. Ross Jr. man accused of kidnapping 9-year-old Charlotte Sena, was previously arrested and charged for choking someone in a 2017 domestic dispute.

title: 2023 MacArthur 'genius grant' fellows include a master hula teacher and a poet laureate
description: A scientist who studies the airborne transmission of diseases, a master hula dancer and the sitting U.S. poet laureate were among the 20 new recipients of the prestigious MacArthur 'genius grant.'

title: Colorado high court to hear case against Christian baker who refused to make trans-themed cake
description: The Colorado Supreme Court will decide whether a Colorado baker discriminated against a transgender woman by refusing to make a cake celebrating her transition.

title: Republican firebrand Jim Jordan, a Trump ally, becomes first to announce speaker bid
description: Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan on Wednesday became the first lawmaker to announce a bid for speaker of the House.

title: Biden to tout efforts to ease student debt, including $9B more in loan forgiveness
description: President Joe Biden will speak about his efforts to address student debt, including $9 billion more in loan relief that the White House announced.

title: Summer flashback to fall frost: Midwest and Northeast to see wild temperature swings
description: It has been a record-smashing start to October, with numerous new high temperatures set from the Upper Midwest to the Northeast.

title: More than 2,000 species of amphibians are threatened by extinction
description: Amphibians are in decline worldwide, with 2 out of every 5 species threatened by extinction, according to a paper published Wednesday in the scientific journal Nature.

title: Season 3 of ‘The Morning Show’ has it all: A lesbian love affair, rural Montana and Jan. 6
description: The latest episode of "The Morning Show" explores the lesbian love affair between Reese Witherspoon’s Bradley Jackson and Julianna Margulies’ Laura Peterson.

title: They paid thousands to give up their U.S. citizenship. Now they want a refund.
description: The price of being an American who lives abroad is often an accent that sticks out, jokes about culinary inferiority and sometimes even issues opening a bank account or buying a home.

title: Israeli police arrest five for hostile gestures toward Christians in Jerusalem
description: Israeli police on Wednesday arrested five people suspected of spitting toward Christians or churches in the Old City of Jerusalem and formed a special investigative team to deal with growing complaints of hostile gestures against Christians.

title: Pilot accused of flying from Vermont  to stalk New York woman
description: A man has been accused of stalking a woman in New York via his small airplane, flying out of an airport in nearby Vermont, police said.

title: Supreme Court weighs curbing disability rights lawsuits
description: The Supreme Court considers whether a disability rights advocate can sue hotels for not disclosing accessibility information if she doesn't plan to book a room.

title: Discrimination may disrupt how the brain and the gut talk to each other, raising risk of obesity, study finds
description: Discrimination can disrupt the gut and the brain, leading people to crave unhealthy foods and may increase risk of obesity.

title: Tupac Shakur’s brother says family remains ‘cautiously optimistic’ after recent arrest
description: The family of Tupac Shakur still has many questions after a man was arrested in connection with the rapper’s 1996 fatal shooting.

title: Inside the anti-LGBTQ effort to put Christianity back in schools
description: The fight to elevate Christianity while restricting LGBTQ and transgender rights in schools is the focus of “Grapevine,” a new narrative podcast by NBC News Studios.

title: Rep. Ruben Gallego snags support from abortion-rights group that once backed Kyrsten Sinema
description: A powerful abortion-rights group is throwing its support behind Ruben Gallego in the Arizona Senate race after backing Kyrsten Sinema in her last election.

title: A national honor recognizes Tejano music legend and pioneer Little Joe
description: Tejano music legend and pioneer Little Joe received the National Heritage Fellowship Award from the National Endowment of the Arts and spoke to NBC News about his life and career.

title: More than 75,000 workers to strike at hundreds of Kaiser Permanente health facilities across U.S.
description: Workers at Kaiser Permanente — the nation’s largest health care nonprofit organization — began a strike Wednesday morning that is set to within hours see more than 75,000 union members walk out of hospitals and medical offices after the company and labor negotiators failed to resolve a dispute over staffing levels.

title: Trump expected to appear for third day of civil fraud trial
description: Trump fraud trial live updates: Former president expected to appear for third day

title: 'Attention — remain calm': Russia tests public warning system
description: Russia tested its emergency public warning systems on Wednesday, sounding sirens and interrupting television and radio to warn the public to stay calm.

title: Seattle to pay almost $2M in death of man whose address was wrongly put on 911 blacklist, delaying medics’ response
description: The city of Seattle will pay $1.86 million to the family of a man who died of a heart attack after a caution note attached to his address delayed medics’ response.

title: 3 scientists win Nobel Prize in chemistry for their work on tiny quantum dots
description: The Nobel Prize in chemistry has been awarded to Moungi Bawendi, Louis Brus and Alexei Ekimov for their work on tiny quantum dots.

title: Pope Francis calls out fossil fuel companies, says climate action is too slow
description: Pope Francis made his strongest statements yet about climate change Wednesday, rebuking fossil fuel companies and urging countries to make an immediate transition to renewable energy.

title: 2 dead, 1 injured after plane crashes through the roof of a home in Oregon
description: Two people are dead and another injured after a small plane crashed through the roof of a home in Oregon on Tuesday night, officials said.

title: Pakistan announces big crackdown on migrants in the country illegally, including 1.7 million Afghans
description: Pakistan’s government announced a major crackdown Tuesday on migrants in the country illegally, saying it would expel them starting next month and raising alarm among foreigners without documentation who include an estimated 1.7 million Afghans.

title: How Vivek Ramaswamy turned his elite education into a degree in devil's advocacy
description: Vivek Ramaswamy, a Republican presidential contender, honed his political identity in the kinds of elite institutions whose norms he has since come to reject.

title: Kevin McCarthy's 'original sin': What drove the House speaker's historic downfall
description: When Kevin McCarthy worked with Democrats on a debt ceiling deal, it was the beginning of the end of his speakership in the House for his party hardliners.

title: Pelosi accuses interim House speaker of ordering her to give up office in Capitol
description: Rep. Nancy Pelosi, a former House speaker, said temporary speaker Patrick McHenry notified her that she must move out of her hideaway office "immediately."

title: Multiple people shot near Morgan State University in Baltimore
description: Baltimore police said that multiple people have been shot at an address that appears close to Morgan State University and that they are investigating an "active shooter."

title: At least 4 people wounded in shooting near Morgan State University in Baltimore
description: Baltimore police said multiple people were shot at an address near Morgan State University.

title: Hardy cancels concerts after hospitalization with anxiety: ‘It has taken over my life’
description: Country music singer Hardy has pulled out from two of his upcoming shows, citing anxiety stemming from his 2022 bus accident.

title: Here’s who Sen. Bob Menendez contacted to allegedly interfere with criminal cases
description: Two of the people were trying to become New Jersey's U.S. Attorney, and the third was the state's attorney general at the time, sources said.

title: Nightly News Full Broadcast (October 3rd)
description: Kevin McCarthy ousted as House speaker after historic vote; Kidnapping suspect in custody after 9-year-old Charlotte Sena was found alive; Trump says he will testify in $250 million civil fraud lawsuit against him; and more on tonight’s broadcast.

title: Philadelphia police say they have a person of interest in journalist's fatal shooting
description: Philadelphia police on Tuesday said they had a person of interest in the fatal shooting of a local journalist.

title: 'Boopac Shakur' was not fatally shot after accusing someone of pedophilia, Michigan officials say
description: The fatal shooting of a Michigan man who was known to try to catch alleged pedophiles online was not connected to a confrontation he had with someone he had accused, officials said Tuesday.

title: 'It was personal,' McCarthy says after being removed as House speaker
description: Rep. Kevin McCarthy called out Rep. Matt Gaetz after he was removed as speaker of the House. “It was personal,” said McCarthy.

title: Trump advisers express skepticism he backed Matt Gaetz's push to oust Kevin McCarthy
description: In the wake of the historic ouster of Rep. Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., as House speaker, there is growing intrigue around whether Trump supported the move.
